name: Concept Look Up & Decomposition
description:
Given a code/system, or a Coding, get additional details about the concept, including definition, status, designations, and properties. One of the products of this operation is a full decomposition of a code from a structured terminology.

When invoking this operation, a client SHALL provide both a system and a code, either using the system+code parameters, or in the coding parameter. Other parameters are optional
comment: Note that the $lookup operation is more than just a code system search  - the server finds the concept, and gathers the return information from the underlying code system definitions.

parameter.name: code
parameter.documentation: The code that is to be located. If a code is provided, a system must be provided

parameter.name: system
parameter.documentation: The system for the code that is to be located

parameter.name: version
parameter.documentation: The version of the system, if one was provided in the source data

parameter.name: date
parameter.documentation: The date for which the information should be returned. Normally, this is the current conditions (which is the default value) but under some circumstances, systems need to acccess this information as it would have been in the past. A typical example of this would be where code selection is constrained to the set of codes that were available when the patient was treated, not when the record is being edited. Note that which date is appropriate is a matter for implementation policy.

parameter.name: property
parameter.documentation: A property that the client wishes to be returned in the output. If no properties are specified, the server chooses what to return. The following properties are defined for all code systems: url, name, version (code system info) and code information: display, definition, designation, parent and child, and for designations, lang.X where X is a designation language code. Some of the properties are returned explicit in named parameters (when the names match), and the rest (except for lang.X) in the property parameter group

parameter.name: name
parameter.documentation: A display name for the code system

parameter.name: version
parameter.documentation: The version that these details are based on

parameter.name: display
parameter.documentation: The preferred display for this concept

part.name: language
part.documentation: The language this designation is defined for

part.name: use
part.documentation: A code that details how this designation would be used

part.name: value
part.documentation: The text value for this designation

parameter.name: property
parameter.documentation: One or more properties that contain additional information about the code, including status. For complex terminologies (e.g. SNOMED CT, LOINC, medications), these properties serve to decompose the code

part.name: value
part.documentation: The value of the property returned

part.name: description
part.documentation: Human Readable representation of the property value (e.g. display for a code)

part.name: subproperty
part.documentation: Nested Properties (mainly used for SNOMED CT decomposition, for relationship Groups)

part.name: value
part.documentation: The value of the sub-property returned

part.name: description
part.documentation: Human Readable representation of the property value (e.g. display for a code)
